sen.j: 細見美術館 (ほそみびじゅつかん) は、京都市左京区岡崎にある、日本の古美術を中心とした私立美術館である。
sen.e: Hosomi Museum is a private art museum mainly devoted to Japnese antiquities, located at Okazaki, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Hosomi Museum is a private art museum mainly devoted to Japanese antiquities, located in Okazaki, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Hosomi Museum is a private art museum mainly devoted to Japanese antiquities, located in Okazaki, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 毛織物で財を成した実業家・細見亮市（通称：細見良、号：古香庵、1901－1978）とその長男・細見實（1922－2006）の2代が収集した東洋古美術品を展示するために開設された美術館である。
sen.e: Hosomi Museum was established to exhibit the collections of Oriental qntiquities collected by the rich businessman, Ryoichi HOSOMI (1901-1978: known by the name of Ryo HOSOMI and his pen-name Go), who amassed his fortune by trade of wool textiles, and his eldest son, Minoru HOSOMI (1922-2006).

Hosomi Museum was established to exhibit collections of Oriental antiquities collected by the wealthy businessman, Ryoichi HOSOMI (1901-1978: also known by the name of Ryo HOSOMI and the pseudonym Kokoan), who amassed his fortune through the trade of woollen textiles, and his eldest son, Minoru HOSOMI (1922-2006).
sen.cmt: 「qntiquities」→「antiquities」,「rich」→「wealthy」, 「also」挿入,「his pen-name Go」→「the pseudonym Kokoan」, 「by trade of wool textiles」→「through the trade of woollen textiles」
sen.e: Hosomi Museum was established to exhibit collections of Oriental antiquities collected by the wealthy businessman, Ryoichi HOSOMI (1901-1978: also known by the name of Ryo HOSOMI and the pseudonym Kokoan), who amassed his fortune through the trade of woollen textiles, and his eldest son, Minoru HOSOMI (1922-2006).

sen.j: 1994年（平成6年）に財団法人細見美術財団として認可され、美術館の開館は1998年（平成10年）であった。
sen.e: In 1994, the Hosomi Art Foundation was established, and the museum was opened in 1998.
In 1994, the Hosomi Art Foundation was established, and the museum was opened in 1998.
In 1994, the Hosomi Art Foundation was established, and the museum was opened in 1998.

sen.j: 細見家の収集品は、琳派や伊藤若冲らなど江戸時代の絵画や平安時代の仏画をはじめ、仏像、仏具などから古墳出土品に至るまで、日本美術のほとんどの分野にわたり、重要文化財 20数件、重要美術品認定物件を多数含む。
sen.e: The Hosomi collection includes almost all the areas of Japanese art: paintings by Rinpa, Jakuchu ITO and other painters in Edo Period; Buddhist paintings, Buddha images and Buddhist altar fittings in Heian Period; artifacts unearthed from ancient tumuluses; and it also includes around two dozen Important Cultural Properties, and many items certified as important art works.

The Hosomi collection includes almost all areas of Japanese art: paintings by Rinpa, Jakuchu ITO and other painters of the Edo Period; Buddhist paintings, Buddha images and Buddhist altar fittings from the Heian Period; artifacts unearthed from ancient tumuli; and it also includes around two dozen Important Cultural Properties, plus many items certified as important art works.

The Hosomi collection includes almost all areas of Japanese art: paintings by Rinpa (a school of Japanese painting originated by KORIN Ogata early in Edo Period), Jakuchu ITO and other painters of the Edo Period; Buddhist paintings, Buddha images and Buddhist altar fittings from the Heian Period; artifacts unearthed from ancient tumuli; and it also includes around two dozen Important Cultural Properties, plus many items certified as important art works.
sen.cmt: Rinpa に英語の説明をつけました。

sen.j: 細見亮市は「世界最高の美術品は日本の藤原時代の仏画だ」「自分は金属工芸からこの道に入ったのでものの形の厳しさと甘さがわかる」と主張していたといい、事実、コレクションのなかでも仏教絵画や仏具、銅鏡などの金工品は傑出している。
sen.e: Ryoichi HOSOMI used to say, "Buddhist paintings of Fujiwara Period Japan are greatest in the world," or, "Because I learned metal works before collecting art works, I can tell superior from poor figures of things," so those Buddhist paintings, and the metal works, such as Buddhist altar fittings and Dokyo (bronze mirrors), are outstanding among his collections,.

It is said that Ryoichi HOSOMI claimed that "Buddhist paintings of Fujiwara Period Japan are the greatest in the world," and "Because I learned about metal crafts before collecting works of art, I can tell superior from things of inferior design," and certainly those Buddhist paintings, and metal works, such as Buddhist altar fittings and Dokyo (bronze mirrors), within his collection are outstanding.

It is said that Ryoichi HOSOMI claimed that 'Buddhist paintings of Fujiwara Period Japan are the greatest in the world,' and 'Because I learned about metal crafts before collecting works of art, I can tell superior from things of inferior design,' and certainly those Buddhist paintings, and metal works, such as Buddhist altar fittings and Dokyo (bronze mirrors), within his collection are outstanding.

sen.j: 美術館は、岡崎公園に隣接し、京都市美術館や京都国立近代美術館などにも近い、文化施設の集まる地域にある。
sen.e: The museum is located next to Okazaki-koen Park, and the area boasts many cultural facilities, such as Kyoto Municipal Museum of Art and the National Museum of Modern Art, Kyoto.
The museum is located next to Okazaki-koen Park, and the area boasts many cultural facilities, such as Kyoto Municipal Museum of Art and the National Museum of Modern Art, Kyoto.
The museum is located next to Okazaki-koen Park, and the area boasts many cultural facilities, such as Kyoto Municipal Museum of Art and the National Museum of Modern Art, Kyoto.

sen.j: 大江匡（おおえただす）設計の建物は、京都の町家のモチーフをとりいれた現代建築で、地下2階から地上3階まで吹き抜けとなった中庭、カフェ・レストラン、屋上庭園、茶室などが憩いの空間を形成している。
sen.e: The building, designed by Tadasu OE, is a modern architecture borowing a motif of the traditional structure of Machiya in Kyoto, and its internal atmosphere is very comfortable with a courtyard surrounded by buildings with two stories below and three above the ground, a coffee shop, a restaurant, a tearoom, and a rooftop garden.

The building, designed by Tadasu OE, is in a modern style of architecture using a motif of the traditional Kyoto machiya, and its internal atmosphere is very comfortable with a courtyard surrounded by buildings with two stories below and three above ground, a coffee shop, a restaurant, a tearoom, and a rooftop garden.
sen.cmt: 「a modern architecture」→「in a modern style of architecture」, 「borowing」→「using」, 「structure of Machiya in Kyoto」→「traditional Kyoto machiya」, 「the」削除
sen.e: The building, designed by Tadasu OE, is in a modern style of architecture using a motif of the traditional Kyoto machiya, and its internal atmosphere is very comfortable with a courtyard surrounded by buildings with two stories below and three above ground, a coffee shop, a restaurant, a tearoom, and a rooftop garden.

sen.j: なお、大阪府泉大津市松ノ浜には、財団が所有する膳所城の高麗門が移築されている。
sen.e: The Koraimon gate of Zeze-jo Castle, which is owned by the foundation, has been moved and reconstructed at Matsunohama, Izumiotsu City, Osaka Prefecture.
The Koraimon gate of Zeze-jo Castle, which is owned by the foundation, has been moved and reconstructed at Matsunohama, Izumiotsu City, Osaka Prefecture.
The Koraimon gate of Zeze-jo Castle, which is owned by the foundation, has been moved and reconstructed at Matsunohama, Izumiotsu City, Osaka Prefecture.

tit.cmt: Collections' indicates several collections, but many are individual exhibits I think.
